block.p: NASCAR--Fined Winston Cup series driver Joe Nemechek $15,0000 and penalized him for rough driving during The Winston at Lowe's Motor Speedway.
NASCAR--Fined Winston Cup series driver Joe Nemechek $15,0000 and penalized him for rough driving during The Winston at Lowe's Motor Speedway.

MLB--Suspended Los Angeles Dodgers C Chad Kreuter, coach Rick Dempsey, coach John Shelby and coach Glenn Hoffman for eight games; LHP Carlos Perez, OF F.P. Santangelo and OF Gary Sheffield for five games; P Mike Fetters for four games; and RHP Terry Adams, RHP Darren Dreifort, RHP Eric Gagne, LHP Onan Masaoka, RHP Alan Mills, RHP Antonio Osuna, RHP Chan Ho Park, C Todd Hundley, 1B Eric Karros, OF Geronimo Berroa and OF Shawn Green for three games each for going into the stands during a fight with fans at Wrigley Field on May 16.

CLEVELAND INDIANS--Placed RHP Paul Shuey on the 15-day disabled list, retroactive to May 21. Purchased the contract of RHP Tim Drew from Akron of the Eastern League. KANSAS CITY ROYALS--Signed Tony Muser, manager, to a two-year contract extension. MINNESOTA TWINS--Named Jerry Bell chief operating officer in addition to his duties as club president, and Chris Clouser chief executive officer. OAKLAND ATHLETICS--Recalled INF Frank Menechino from Sacramento of the Pacific Coast League. Sent INF Jorge Velandia outright to Sacramento.

ATLANTA BRAVES--Placed RHP Kevin McGlinchy on the 15-day disabled list. Recalled RHP Kerry Ligtenberg from Richmond of the International League. NEW YORK METS--Signed INF Jed Hansen to a minor league contract. PHILADELPHIA PHILLIES--Agreed to terms with OF Lawrence Alexander. SAN FRANCISCO GIANTS--Activated OF Ellis Burks from the 15-day disabled list. Optioned RHP Ben Weber to Fresno of the Pacific Coast League.

SAN JOSE GIANTS--Placed C Sammy Serrano on the disabled list, retroactive to May 23. Received C Bob Niemet from extended spring training. SALEM AVALANCHE--Acquired RHP Steve Matcuk from Carolina of the Southern League. Sent RHP Rob Burger to Asheville of the South Atlantic League.

COOK COUNTY CHEETAHS--Signed RHP Gerald Yuscavage, LHP Nick Morris and RHP Raul Rivera. DUBOIS COUNTY DRAGONS--Signed OF Ben Danosky. Released OF Tom Kuempel and RHP Todd Anderson. JOHNSTOWN JOHNNIES--Released OF Daryl Rutherfod, LHP Rick Swanger, OF-1B Dawan Elliott, OF Mike Dieke and C Eric Mathews. RIVER CITY RASCALS--Signed RHP Shawn Hoggs and OF Travis Dawson. Announced the retirement of RHP Josh Levey. SPRINGFIELD CAPITALS--Signed LHP Jeremy Cox and RHP Chris Havens.
NBA--Fined Miami Heat owner Micky Arison $25,000, G Tim Hardaway $20,000, and F Jamal Mashburn $10,000 for criticizing officials following Game 7 of the Eastern Conference semifinals.
CBA--Promoted Matt Correa from basketball operations coordinator to director of basketball operations.

ATLANTIC CITY SEAGULLS--Released C Alvin Robinson, F Eric Coates and G Donnie Seales. FLORIDA SEA DRAGONS--Signed C Earl Ike. Activated G Keweemada King from the inactive list. Placed G Franklin Paul, G Brandon Wharton and F Ajani Williams on the inactive list. OKLAHOMA STORM--Placed C Brett Robisch on the inactive list. Signed F Brian Montonati.

ARIZONA CARDINALS--Signed OT Jerry Drake to a one-year contract. ATLANTA FALCONS--Waived TE Brian Saxton. CHICAGO BEARS--Named Scott Campbell director of pro personnel. CINCINNATI BENGALS--Signed OT Willie Anderson to a six-year contract extension. HOUSTON--Promoted Mike Maccagnan from pro scout to coordinator of college scouting. JACKSONVILLE JAGUARS--Signed OL Mark Baniewicz. NEW YORK JETS--Re-signed NT Jason Ferguson. Signed WR Windrell Hayes.

BRITISH COLUMBIA LIONS--Signed QB Donnie Davis. CALGARY STAMPEDERS--Signed LB Kent Ring and QB Troy Kopp. SASKATCHEWAN ROUGHRIDERS--Signed QB Keith Smith. Announced the retirement of QB Steve Sarkisian.

LOS ANGELES AVENGERS--Signed DS Kevin Cobb. Activated FB-LB Brian Easter from the refused to report list. Activated FB-LB Terrance Petty from the injured reserve list and placed him on waivers. Placed OL-DL Bruce Walker on waivers. Placed DS Ken Haslip on the injured reserve list. OKLAHOMA WRANGLERS--Signed QB Justin Fuente.
COLUMBUS CREW--Named Dave Stephany assistant director of public relations, Ryan Smith event manager and Kristine Hoolwerf marketing coordinator.
AVCA--Announced the resignation of Sandra L. Vivas, executive director, effective July 31.

ATLANTIC 10--Announced Richmond will join the conference in all sports, effective July 1, 2001. ARMSTRONG ATLANTIC--Named Michael Butler men's golf coach. FLORIDA INTERNATIONAL--Named Joe Barantovich, Hurlie Brown, James Colzie, Carmen Grosso, Bruce Hardy and Curt Wiles assistant football coaches. FRANKLIN--Named Lori Wilkerson assistant director of athletics and volleyball coach. GREENSBORO--Announced the resignation of Bill Chambers, men's basketball and cross country coach. HOUSTON--Announced the resignation of Chris Huston, women's soccer coach. LEHMAN--Named Steven Schulman men's basketball coach. MONTANA STATE--Announced the resignations of Heidi Tate, tennis director and women's tennis coach, and Dean Owen, men's tennis coach. OREGON--Signed Bill Moos, athletic director, to a four-year contract extension. PRESBYTERIAN--Named Paul Maxwell men's tennis coach. SAN DIEGO ST.--Promoted Rick Bay from athletic director to executive director of athletics and special assistant to the president, and signed him to a five-year extension. TIFFIN--Named Jeremy Croy track and field coach and women's cross-country coach.
